content.question: A bowling pin is thrown vertically upward such that it rotates as it moves through the air, as shown in the figure. Initially, the center of mass of the bowling pin is moving upward with a speed <math alttext="v sub i " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="10 meters per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext>â€‰</mtext><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. The maximum height of the center of mass of the bowling pin is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction v sub i, end sub, squared, over 2 times g, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 2 times g, over v sub i, end sub, squared, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>
The answer cannot be determined without knowing how long it takes the bowling pin to reach its maximum height.
The answer cannot be determined because an irregularly shaped object is too complex to treat as a single point mass.

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction v sub i, end sub, squared, over 2 times g, end fraction" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
